column4: My friend wants to dualboot with Ubuntu, but we've ran into a problem during the installation. can someone please help diagnose this?
the problem is?
The guide says that ubuntu should detect the vista patrition
but it's failing to do so.
I can link you his screenshots in a moment
okay, the guide says the screenshot should be like this, with the migration assistant saying that there's a vista patrition
http://snipurl.com/1qzma
but his is actually like this: http://snipurl.com/1qzmj.
so what's the issue? i dont believe it's gonna wipe the entire drive
and here's what vista's patritoner shows: http://snipurl.com/1qzmo
yeah but it's not detecting vista! And his patritions look weird
that final screenshot -does- look in line with his patritons, right?
yes, its OEM junk
you know, recovery partitions and all that
right. But did ubuntu select the right empty patrition? I can't really tell
not sure about detection business, dont really have to
if you're not sure, you can always do manual
ehh not an option here
pastebin the output of sudo fdisk -l then :)
from the livecd?
yeah
here's the output of the fdisk (http://pastebin.ca/705337). Is it right?
here's the output of fdisk (http://pastebin.ca/7053370). Does it look right?
okay, we'll try and go ahead with the install..
